DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Adverse Event Recovery Prior Study Agent Initiation Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow clinical trial participation, as outlined in the study protocol, that address the receipt of radiation therapy and the recovery from adverse events prior to the start of investigational therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Adverse Event Recovery Prior Protocol Agent Initiation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury._Earlier in time or order._A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial._The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredName: Adverse Event Recovery Prior Protocol Agent Initiation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.:Earlier in time or order.:A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.:The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.
A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.
The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has received any p
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received any prior radiation was it completed at least 7 days prior to the start of study drugs and the patient has recovered from any acute adverse effects prior to the start of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior definitive radiation, was it completed greater than or equal to 4 weeks or palliative radiation was completed greater than or equal to 2 weeks prior to study enrollment and all associated toxicities resolved to eligibility levels?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Had patient received wide field radiotherapy (including therapeutic radioisotopes such as strontium 89) administered less than or equal to 28 days or limited field radiation for palliation less than or equal to 7 days prior to starting study drug or has not recovered from side effects of such therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient fully recovered from the acute toxic effects of XRT/External Beam Irradiation including Protons?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from all radiation-related toxicities, does not require corticosteroids, and has not had radiation pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior radiotherapy, have at least 28 days elapsed between the end of radiotherapy and randomization and patient has recovered from the acute effects of radiotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient received prior radiation therapy, have the adverse effects of radiation therapy resolved to baseline prior to Cycle 1 Day 1?
